channel.title: firefox cpu usage
channel.description:
Hello everyone, I have a strange problem, Firefox uses at least 25% of my CPU permanently. I could find out that ZwWaitForSingleObject is causing this and that this functions is from module ntdll. What can I do now to stop it from using 25% of my CPU permanently?
EDIT: I found out that notepad++ has the same problem with the same function EDIT2: Firefox 3.6.12 Gecko/20101026 .NET CLR 3.5.30729 Notepad 5.4.2 AMD Phenom II 955(4 x 3.2GHz)

item.title: firefox cpu usage
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
ok after the problem returned I tried a few other things and noticed that this happens only with RadeonPro running.

Read full topic

item.title: firefox cpu usage
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
firefox uses 100% of CPU power on my pentium II laptop which is running windows 98 se

for old computers I recommend opera 9.51, but for a phenom II any version of ff should be no problem, on my desktop I run minefield (nightly build)

Read full topic

item.description:
johnyo:

Try disabling some of the plugins you ff users are so taken with.

he had the same problem with notepad++, so yeah …

ok, I guess I fixed it now by reinstalling .net stuff and vc++ redist.
Thanks for your idiotism!

item.title: firefox cpu usage
item.dc:creator: pfannkuchen_gesicht
item.description:
Hello everyone,
I have a strange problem, Firefox uses at least 25% of my CPU permanently.
I could find out that ZwWaitForSingleObject is causing this and that this functions is from module ntdll.
What can I do now to stop it from using 25% of my CPU permanently?

EDIT: I found out that notepad++ has the same problem with the same function
EDIT2:
Firefox 3.6.12 Gecko/20101026 .NET CLR 3.5.30729
Notepad 5.4.2
AMD Phenom II 955(4 x 3.2GHz)
